alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Big Horn and southeastern Treasure Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 844 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm 14 miles south of Custer, or 15 miles northeast of Hardin, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 8:34 PM, nickel size hail was reported 2 miles north of Hardin. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bighorn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
